author: HUMBERP
body: ### Prerequisites - [X] Write a descriptive title. - [X] Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases) - [X] Search the existing issues. - [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md). - [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell). ### Steps to reproduce In version 7.1.5 if calling Invoke-WebRequest i get a webresponse object if parameter -SkipHttpErrorCheck is set and the request leads to an error. With version 7.2.0 i get no response object instead an exception. ### Expected behavior ```console PS C:\> $PSVersionTable Name Value ---- ----- PSVersion 7.1.5 PSEdition Core GitCommitId 7.1.5 OS Microsoft Windows 10.0.14393 Platform Win32NT PSCompatibleVersions {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…} PSRemotingProtocolVersion 2.3 SerializationVersion 1.1.0.1 WSManStackVersion 3.0 PS C:\> $RequestUri https://api.github.com/repos/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/latest PS C:\> Invoke-WebRequest -Uri $RequestUri -SkipHttpErrorCheck StatusCode : 407 StatusDescription : ProxyAuthenticationRequired Content : https://api.github.com/*; tagName=A; href=https://api.github.com/*}, @{outerHTML=cache administrator; tagName=A; href=mailto:no-reply@domain.com?subject=CacheErrorInfo%20-%20ERR_CACHE_AC CESS_DENIED&body=CacheHost%3A%20ER0322F002.epit.cc%0D%0AErrPage%3A%20ERR_CACHE_ACCESS_DENIED%0D %0AErr%3A%20%5Bnone%5D%0D%0ATimeStamp%3A%20Tue,%2009%20Nov%202021%2009%3A15%3A10%20GMT%0D%0A%0D%0AC lientIP%3A%2010.222.111.175%0D%0A%0D%0AHTTP%20Request%3A%0D%0ACONNECT%20%20HTTP%2F1.1%0AUser-Agent% 3A%20Mozilla%2F5.0%20(Windows%20NT%2010.0%3B%20Microsoft%20Windows%2010.0.14393%3B%20de-DE)%20Power Shell%2F7.1.5%0D%0AHost%3A%20api.github.com%3A443%0D%0A%0D%0A%0D%0A}} RawContentLength : 147948 RelationLink : {} PS C:\> ``` ### Actual behavior ```console PS C:\> $PSVersionTable Name Value ---- ----- PSVersion 7.2.0 PSEdition Core GitCommitId 7.2.0 OS Microsoft Windows 10.0.14393 Platform Win32NT PSCompatibleVersions {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…} PSRemotingProtocolVersion 2.3 SerializationVersion 1.1.0.1 WSManStackVersion 3.0 PS C:\> $RequestUri = 'https://api.github.com/repos/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/latest' PS C:\> Invoke-WebRequest -Uri $RequestUri -SkipHttpErrorCheck Invoke-WebRequest: The proxy tunnel request to proxy 'http://proxyserver/' failed with status code '407'." PS C:\> ``` ### Error details _No response_ ### Environment data ```powershell Name Value ---- ----- PSVersion 7.2.0 PSEdition Core GitCommitId 7.2.0 OS Microsoft Windows 10.0.14393 Platform Win32NT PSCompatibleVersions {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…} PSRemotingProtocolVersion 2.3 SerializationVersion 1.1.0.1 WSManStackVersion 3.0 ``` ### Visuals _No response_

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: I guess it is how .Net now works. I am not sure whether we name this a regression.

comments.author: HUMBERP
comments.body:
From a PowerShell point of view, the Cmdlet behaves now completely different as before. For my purpose i rely on the webresponse object and use this extensively.
I think this should be fixed in the way the cmdlet works as before.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: The error reported is _proxy_ related. So first question is - is this .Net regression or it is by-design? If it is a regression it must be fixed in .Net.

comments.author: HUMBERP
comments.body:
I can't answer your question, because i'am just using powershell .

I tested a different case and SkipHttpErrorCheck is honored when the response got ErrorCode 401 (Cmdlet not used behind a proxy).
May be this helps to classify the issue correct.
I changed the title to be more precise.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @HUMBERP Thanks! I found https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/issues/48679 This says the behavior is by-design. We can not change this because it is security related.

comments.author: HUMBERP
comments.body:
Ok, is there a suggestion how to get the statuscode?
If i catch the exception which is thrown, there is no field to see that it's StatusCode 407 ProxyAuthentication Required. To make a string search within the exception message seems to me error prone.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: I see it returns HttpRequestException with a status code. Get-Error should show you all fields.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: I wonder if you use a proxy why don't you set proxy credentials in the request?

comments.author: HUMBERP
comments.body:
After further investigation, for our regular process proxy credentials are always present and this should have no impact. 

It's more on a manual basis, when I use my own written cmdlets and there is an opportunity to make requests to the cloud or wihtin the internal network. The own cmdlets have the parameter for proxy and if given, everything works fine, but if I forget to pass the proxycredentials the cmdlet should just inform and not throw an exception ...
I updated powershell to 7.2.0 on some servers to see if there is no issue ...

Thank you for your support.

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as answered and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been closed for housekeeping purposes.

title: Invoke-WebRequest switch SkipHttpErrorCheck is ignored on response code 407
